item.title: Annyoing noobs
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[size=2pt]cough he he you call them noobs? cough[/size]

first your going to need a writer to write the players name a file

[code] public void appendToBanned(String player) {

    BufferedWriter bw = null;

    try {
        bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("data/bannedusers.txt", true));
        bw.write(player);
        bw.newLine();
        bw.flush();
    } catch (IOException ioe) {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    } finally {
        if (bw != null) {
            try {
                bw.close();
            } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                sendMessage("Error banning user!");
            }
        }
    }

}[/code]

then youll need a reader to check and see if the user is banned or not

[code] public int checkbannedusers() {
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
new FileReader(“data/bannedusers.txt”));
String data = null;

        while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
            if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) {
                closeClient();
                return 5;
            }
        }
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while checking banned users!");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    return 0;
}[/code]

after that you need to declare weather or not the player can get in or not if their banned
so add this to the method run

checkbannedusers(); if (checkbannedusers() == 5) { returnCode = 4; savefile = false; closeClient(); System.out.println( playerName + " failed to logon because they are banned."); appendToLR( playerName + " failed to logon because they are banned."); }

i use this to keep people out

[code] public void closeClient() {
try {
java.net.Socket s = server.clientListener.accept();

        disconnected = true;
        this.destruct();
        s.close();
    } catch (IOException ioe) {}
}[/code]

then if you want a command to ban them here it is

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“banuser”)
&& (playerRights >= 1 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Admin”))) {
String victim = command.substring(8);

        PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
        System.out.println("Admin:" + playerName + " is banning " + victim);
        sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully banned");
        appendToBanned(victim);
    }[/code]
